subject: Re: Need more Help on EMF
msgSnippet: Wow - That s really strangeR. Maybe the update manager is trying to find updates compatible with the manual install you did earlier. Try downloading a brand
messageBody:
Wow - That's really strangeR.

Maybe the update manager is trying to find updates
compatible with the manual install you did earlier.

Try downloading a brand new version of Eclipse.

It should have update sites configured already.

But, if it does not, just add the one you are using.

Then try the update again.

Let me know how that works.

Cheers,
- Ole

--- bohs01@... wrote:

> Hi Ole,
>
>
> Yea its really strange. For starters, according to
> the plugin details
> I dont have it instaleld. I am using Eclipse sdk
> 3.2.1.
>
> In addition when i use the the update site u
> mentioned, it said no new
> features found?
>
> Cheers,
> Jimm
>
>
>
> Quoting Ole Ersoy <ole_ersoy@...>:
>
> > Hey Jimm,
> >
> > That's strange.
> >
> > Try this for the update site:
> >
> > http://update.eclipse.org/updates
> >
> > I thought my version of Eclipse came with the
> update
> > site in the default install. I'm running on
> Fedora
> > Core though.
> >
> > It should be really easy to install.
> >
> > When you go to
> >
> > Help > About Eclipse SDK > Plugin Details
> >
> > you don't see the EMF plugins listed?
> >
> > What version of eclipse are you running?
> >
> > OK - Lets try the update site, and take it from
> there.
> >
> > Cheers,
> > - Ole
> >
> >
> > --- bohs01@... wrote:
> >
> >> Hi Ole,
> >>
> >> Thanks for taking the time to help me out :)
> >>
> >> I've unzipped those items in the bundle and
> copied
> >> them to the
> >> respective features and plugins directories
> >>
> >>
> >> however it doesnt install? and i still cant use
> the
> >> JET features.
> >>
> >> As for updating via software update i need to
> >> provide a url for it to
> >> find updates... do you by any chance know of the
> >> url? I cant find it
> >> on the EMF website
> >>
> >> Regards,
> >> Jimm
